introduction: We try almost anything to avoid saying how we truly feel - or what we honestly want. The chances of

vocabulary.definition: Bitter indignation at having been treated unfairly.
vocabulary.example: She couldn't hide her resentment towards her coworker for taking credit for her idea.

vocabulary.definition: Tending to avoid or keep distant from unpleasant or dangerous things.
vocabulary.example: He had an avoidant attitude towards conflicts, always trying to stay out of arguments.

vocabulary.definition: Annoy or irritate a person with persistent fault-finding or continuous urging.
vocabulary.example: She would constantly nag him about picking up his clothes from the floor.

vocabulary.definition: Having or revealing a tendency to be easily shocked by matters relating to sex or nudity.
vocabulary.example: Her prudish nature made it difficult for her to talk openly about intimacy.

vocabulary.definition: Easily broken or damaged; delicate or vulnerable.
vocabulary.example: After the accident, she felt emotionally fragile and needed time to heal.

vocabulary.definition: Anger or annoyance provoked by what is perceived as unfair treatment.
vocabulary.example: His face showed clear indignation at the unjust accusation made against him.
